comment: I am so confused about pressure is being an intensive property.I know the rule of ratio of two extensive propery is intensive and formula of pressure P=F/A makes sense.However , as you know there is another definition of intensive property which does not chance by the amount or size.In the light of this definition take beaker which is full of 100 ml of water.And knowing that liquid pressure is P=ρgh , we pour down half of the water and only 50 ml of water remains and our ''h'' will be get smaller.If the ''h'' gets smaller pressure will decrease too.Any ideas at what point am I making a mistake?
